verses.verse: Keep <WH8104> thy foot <WH7272> when thou goest <WH3212> to the house <WH1004> of God <WH430>, and be more ready <WH7138> to hear <WH8085>, than to give <WH5414> the sacrifice <WH2077> of fools <WH3684>: for they consider <WH3045> not that they do <WH6213> evil <WH7451>.

Be not rash <WH926> with thy mouth <WH6310>, and let not thine heart <WH3820> be hasty <WH4116> to utter <WH3318> any thing <WH1697> before <WH6440> God <WH430>: for God <WH430> is in heaven <WH8064>, and thou upon earth <WH776>: therefore let thy words <WH1697> be few <WH4592>.
For a dream <WH2472> cometh <WH935> through the multitude <WH7230> of business <WH6045>; and a fool's <WH3684> voice <WH6963> is known by multitude <WH7230> of words <WH1697>.
When thou vowest <WH5087> a vow <WH5088> unto God <WH430>, defer <WH309> not to pay <WH7999> it; for he hath no pleasure <WH2656> in fools <WH3684>: pay <WH7999> that which thou hast vowed <WH5087>.
Better <WH2896> is it that thou shouldest not vow <WH5087>, than that thou shouldest vow <WH5087> and not pay <WH7999>.

Suffer <WH5414> not thy mouth <WH6310> to cause thy flesh <WH1320> to sin <WH2398>; neither say <WH559> thou before <WH6440> the angel <WH4397>, that it was an error <WH7684>: wherefore should God <WH430> be angry <WH7107> at thy voice <WH6963>, and destroy <WH2254> the work <WH4639> of thine hands <WH3027>?
For in the multitude <WH7230> of dreams <WH2472> and many <WH7235> words <WH1697> there are also divers vanities <WH1892>: but fear <WH3372> thou God <WH430>.

¶ If thou seest <WH7200> the oppression <WH6233> of the poor <WH7326>, and violent <WH1499> perverting of judgment <WH4941> and justice <WH6664> in a province <WH4082>, marvel <WH8539> not at the matter <WH2656>: for he that is higher <WH1364> than the highest <WH1364> regardeth <WH8104>; and there be higher <WH1364> than they <WH5921>.
¶ Moreover the profit <WH3504> of the earth <WH776> is for all: the king <WH4428> himself is served <WH5647> by the field <WH7704>.
He that loveth <WH157> silver <WH3701> shall not be satisfied <WH7646> with silver <WH3701>; nor he that loveth <WH157> abundance <WH1995> with increase <WH8393>: this is also vanity <WH1892>.

When goods <WH2896> increase <WH7235>, they are increased <WH7231> that eat <WH398> them: and what good <WH3788> is there to the owners <WH1167> thereof, saving <WH518> the beholding <WH7207> <WH7212> of them with their eyes <WH5869>?

The sleep <WH8142> of a labouring man <WH5647> is sweet <WH4966>, whether he eat <WH398> little <WH4592> or much <WH7235>: but the abundance <WH7647> of the rich <WH6223> will not suffer <WH3240> him to sleep <WH3462>.
There is <WH3426> a sore <WH2470> evil <WH7451> which I have seen <WH7200> under the sun <WH8121>, namely, riches <WH6239> kept <WH8104> for the owners <WH1167> thereof to their hurt <WH7451>.
But those riches <WH6239> perish <WH6> by evil <WH7451> travail <WH6045>: and he begetteth <WH3205> a son <WH1121>, and there is nothing <WH3972> in his hand <WH3027>.

As he came forth <WH3318> of his mother's <WH517> womb <WH990>, naked <WH6174> shall he return <WH7725> to go <WH3212> as he came <WH935>, and shall take <WH5375> nothing <WH3972> of his labour <WH5999>, which he may carry away <WH3212> in his hand <WH3027>.

And this <WH2090> also is a sore <WH2470> evil <WH7451>, that in all points <WH5980> as he came <WH935>, so shall he go <WH3212>: and what profit <WH3504> hath he that hath laboured <WH5998> for the wind <WH7307>?
All his days <WH3117> also he eateth <WH398> in darkness <WH2822>, and he hath much <WH7235> sorrow <WH3707> and wrath <WH7110> with his sickness <WH2483>.

¶ Behold that which I have seen <WH7200>: it is good <WH2896> and comely <WH3303> for one to eat <WH398> and to drink <WH8354>, and to enjoy <WH7200> the good <WH2896> of all his labour <WH5999> that he taketh <WH5998> under the sun <WH8121> all <WH4557> the days <WH3117> of his life <WH2416>, which God <WH430> giveth <WH5414> him: for it is his portion <WH2506>.

Every man <WH120> also to whom God <WH430> hath given <WH5414> riches <WH6239> and wealth <WH5233>, and hath given him power <WH7980> to eat <WH398> thereof, and to take <WH5375> his portion <WH2506>, and to rejoice <WH8055> in his labour <WH5999>; this <WH2090> is the gift <WH4991> of God <WH430>.
For he shall not much <WH7235> remember <WH2142> the days <WH3117> of his life <WH2416>; because God <WH430> answereth <WH6031> him in the joy <WH8057> of his heart <WH3820>.
